The Klingsporn track was the bridle trail in days gone by when stockmen would take their cattle up high for the summer months.
The walk begins at Merimbah and is a 8km walk on a well defined track.
An adventurous twist on this walk is to walk to the aptly named "Thank Christ Corner" on Shoulder spur and go off track along shoulder spur to Mclaughlin's spur to the summit.
Mclaughlins spur offers good views to the summit fire tower and the rocky outcrops that must be traversed.
At the summit there is a stone distance dial and a fire tower that is manned during the summer months.
